oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US officers red silk sash
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Red silk officers sash belonged to Lt. Sam Swafford, Co. D, 7th Tenn. Mtd. Inf. Regt. USA. Swafford, aged 22 years, was appointed from civilian life to fill a vacancy in the company on April 18, 1865 in Athens, Tennesse. He served with his regiment until mustering out in July 1865 at Nashville, Tennessee. The regiment spent most of the war in and around Athens, Tennessee on anti-guerrllla operations and guarding mountain passes.
